column4: hello, I am a new ubuntu user, I installed in on my SONY VAIO laptop....  I was using windos for years, just installed ubuntu last week... I usually plug in my HDTV through HDMI to my laptop..... When i plug in the HDMI in my laptop now since it has ubuntu...it changes the resolution to very low.... how do i changed the resolution back to high....
what is your video card?
I am not sure, I have a new Sony Vaio with bluray,,,,
run lspci in terminal, and tell me what your video card is
ooh. well if James3 has nvidia, you help him, cause i only know how to do this for ATI cards
why does my viode card matter?  why cant I just reset the resolution somwhere?
wtf?
ubuntu works fine with my laptop, the resolution is very high and excellent, but when i plug the HDMI into my laptop to my TV, it thros it into low res
how do I change it back to high res
aparently its a 3650
the HDMI cable is coming from your video card...
ATI Inc Mobility Radeon HD 3650
ok
dude, the HDMI is plugged into the only place it can be plugged into the laptop\
I have done this for years on windows, never had an issue
i dont know why ubuntu is throwing it into like really low resolution
the resolution is so low i can only see 1/8 of my screen
it's because you don't have the right drivers installed or you aren't in your driver settings
run "sudo aptitude install fglrx"
I ran that and it says audo: aptitude: command not found
i use debian, so ubuntu may need apt-get
follow the directions on this page: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI
